review_text: It was excellent, it explains clearly how to use several different relevant AI tools for web development, and also how to build apps.

I'm already an experienced developer, but I bought this course because I was looking to use AI to increase my productivity. What I immediately liked about Brendan was that he doesn't spread the typical smoke sold by vibecoders, who claim that AI tools have rendered coding knowledge unnecessary, and that you can just ask an AI to make an app for you in one go and ship it to production that way, with no idea of what it did. We have seen many times that this only results in extremely incompetently coded software with hilarious bugs that are quickly exploited by hackers.

I really enjoyed this course and I learned a lot from this. The only gotcha for me is that I use Windows and not a Mac. So there could be some nuances between the 2 machine types that could impact the way you specify a command. For example, Ctrl-S/Ctrl-C/Ctrl-L is common on Windows. Mac has a CMD key whereas Windows has a WIN key. Stuff like that. Thank you for this course.
Great value for money, straight to the point. Expecting more courses to come out as technology evolves.
Mostly this course is for novice, but for me as quite an experienced engineer it was useful as well. Mostly I liked an overview of different AI tools and their combinations.

I gained a lot from the course, but it is designed for senior software architects with extensive hands-on experience in the technologies used by the instructor. The instructor is using a lot of different versions of the AI and tools and leaves out a LOT of details that would be needed by an ordinary student.
Good enough, kind of obsolete because V0 and Cursor recent "Agent" implementation
It is for someone who already has some IT or programming background; otherwise, you would get lost. He should have provided the course materials to revisit.
Well enough for vibe coding and web and app creation, but need some info to create better UI/UX design to create smooth and stunning web apps.
it is very thorough - step-by- step, doesnt overwhelm. good examples

Well designed for people that do not have any expertise on coding web application, and on the same time there are useful suggestion on how to use AI to speedup development process even for seasoned developers.
Amazing! One of the best courses Iâ€™ve ever taken.

The course material for copy and past into cursor is limited. I want step by step, and this is missing. I'm moving on to another course and not completing this one. It's good up the step by step install.

margin , padding and css essentials
Great Course so far! Thank you so much.
I feel like the course content is disorganized. It feels scattered.

I can't exactly blame the instructor, but the nature of AI makes it so that prompts output different results, and version changes result in different functions. But so far I've been very disappointed with the preparation. At the very least, the instructor could have prepared what output we should expect to see, rather than saying that this is "boiler plate code" or "standard stuff". It is even more frustrating when you try to emulate the instructor's exact steps, but fall flat with errors that take awhile to debug. Hey at least you are learning. But I am paying someone to figure this out for me - to better prepare me for what's going to come, rather than leaving me to figure it out myself for which I can also do on my own, without paying for a course. I hate to give negative reviews but this is by far, one of the most annoying courses I've taken. Ambitious but execution leaving much to be desired.
not sharing the notes or AI rules that are used or the PRD script those that are used in the training
If you have an idea and are looking to develop it yourself without any coding experience, I believe, this is the best place to start.
The is no prompts mentioned that we can copy and paste. This is creating too many errors as we don't have exact prompt the auther types in.

The teacher is great â€” clearly knowledgeable and engaging. That said, I think the course could be much stronger with a more focused structure. It would have been better to zero in on Cursor and Next.js, going deep into the core concepts and building a clear, cohesive tutorial around them.
Well designed for people that do not have any expertise on coding web application. I really enjoyed this course and I learned a lot from this.

The tutorial lacks clear, step-by-step explanations of basic tasks. It assumes the reader already knows how to install the necessary software and packages, which is not ideal for a non-technical audience. The content feels poorly explained and not beginner-friendly, despite being aimed at people without a software engineering background.

In your video, you didnâ€™t show how to install Cursor or which IDE youâ€™re using. Initially, you said that coding is not required, but later you started writing code. Youâ€™ve missed a lot of important details, and it feels more like youâ€™re learning for yourself rather than teaching others.

for a person who understand basic coding it was quite hard to follow in some sections. It would be helpful to provide the documents to download like the PRD you got the AI to produce and the rules you used in Cursor.
Good and detailed explanation. Easy to understand.
I have never been addicted to a course before.
so informative and the instructor made it clear for beginners yet sometimes It become too repetitive , otherwise it was excellent course I learned a lot .

I like this course a lot and it isn't because it's perfect. Perfection with a course like this is almost impossible due to all of the variations presented with the evolving tech. The instructor gives clear demonstrations of the process, and you should be able to take the ideas and implement them to whatever challenges are thrown at you.

Only partway through, so grain of salt etc.: I've found this is a useful course as someone new to AI coding and IDEs etc â€“ but I've worked in traditional development for years and have some history with hand-rolled React, so I just want to advise that there are many subtle errors throughout the narration. I haven't seen anything 'breaking' or major so far, but lots of little tidbits that betray some misunderstanding of HTML/CSS/JS. So just approach that content with healthy skepticism, or feel encouraged to double-check the content if you are hitting walls â€“ that's all.
Great course so far. enjoying it. Had to figure some parts out in terms of installation but looks okay so far

Brendan is a concise and knowledgeable teacher. However, I think anyone who does this course really needs to know something about coding ie HTML etc. I have set up websites, so this is not hard for me, but anyone who has never coded might find this a little confusing at first. I would recommend it would be a good idea to do a short course in HTML/CSS to get a better understanding of some of the facets of the course. Otherwise very good.
Instructor knows material well and communicates the knowledge in an easy to understand and effective way. Builds a comprehensive foundation for what comes next.

Instructor has a good grasp of the material but is not an effective teacher. The class would benefit from better organization. There should be an exposition of the underlying principles. The instructor should show the finished projects before building them. I am an experienced senior developer and architect. (P.S. "Claude" is not pronounced "Cloud")
